text: Hi, can you guys recommend any conferences/attached workshops that would be good targets for smaller SciML publications? I'm struggling a bit figuring this out since all the Karniadakis PINN stuff usually went into JCOMP and most "application papers" are residing in domain-specific journals/conferences. I'm working on a PINN edge case which is most probably not general/novel enough for the big ML conferences like ICML etc...

elements.text: Hi, can you guys recommend any conferences/attached workshops that would be good targets for smaller SciML publications? I'm struggling a bit figuring this out since all the Karniadakis PINN stuff usually went into JCOMP and most "application papers" are residing in domain-specific journals/conferences. text: Generally conference publications are not a thing though.

elements.text: Generally conference publications are not a thing though.

text: It is in CS, which is a field specific behavior I think ><

elements.text: It is in CS, which is a field specific behavior I think ><

text: Indeed. SciML has a mixture of computational science culture and computer science culture, and in computational science culture a conference paper isn't a big deal.

elements.text: Indeed. SciML has a mixture of computational science culture and computer science culture, and in computational science culture a conference paper isn't a big deal.

text: but the two pieces that look a bit more ML are those two conferences, which I'd say are probably the conferences of the field, at least right now.

text: Thanks for the input. That helps! Since I'm in a CS group myself I wasn't aware conference publications are that unique to the field.
